Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Hemolysis During Bed Rest and Nutritional Intervention

Trial_Design.evidence: In a prospective randomized clinical trial, 20 male participants were recruited

Participants.evidence: Eligibility criteria included age 20-45 years and BMI 22-27 kg/m².

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomized to receive either a control diet or a diet supplemented with polyphenols, omega-3, vitamin E, and selenium.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to assess hemolysis during 60 days of bed rest and the effect of a nutritional intervention.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was endogenous carbon monoxide (CO) elimination, measured by gas chromatography over 60 days.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to outcome assessors.

Result_Outcome.evidence: CO elimination increased significantly after 5, 11, 30, and 57 days of bed rest compared to baseline.

Funding.evidence: The study was funded by the Center National d’Etudes Spatiales and the European Space Agency.
